entries.title: E-Commerce Retail Just Passed $1 Trillion For The First Time Ever
entries.description: “The strong 18% growth of digital commerce seen in Q4 was driven largely by mobile’s 26% YoY jump,” the latest State of Commerce report from Comscore says. “After multiple years of hovering in the low 30s, mobile’s share of total digital commerce dollars has nearly reached 40%.”

entries.title: Why Winter Harassment Of Urban Canada Geese Doesn’t Make Them Go Away
entries.description: Canada geese that left a Chicago park returned twice as quickly when harassed, compared with days when they left of their own accord

entries.title: Donald Trump Might Make A Triumphant Return To Social Media (After That: So Long Truth Social)
entries.description: For people like me who keep an eye on social media trends, the fact that Donald Trump could start posting on Facebook and Twitter again soon is a pretty big deal.

entries.title: Three Unique Embedded Fintech Distribution Models Growing Fast
entries.description:
Embedded financial services– whereby any company layers financial services into its offering – is all the rage in fintech.

Yet for many, what this means in practice remains amorphous. To make this real, we cover three rapidly growing and exciting embedded fintech categories.

entries.title: No, Project Veritas Video Doesn’t Prove Pfizer Is Mutating Covid-19, Who Is Jordon Trishton Walker?
entries.description: A Project Veritas video claimed that it featured someone named “Jordon Trishton Walker, Pfizer Director of Research and Development - Strategic Operations and mRNA Scientific Planning.”

entries.description: Technology and the internet are changing how we behave in romantic relationships. Sometimes for worse.

entries.title: Milan Mayor’s Desire To Cut Car Use Shared By Luxury Real Estate Developers
entries.description: Milan is planning to build one of the most ambitious active travel networks in the world—and upmarket real estate developers are just as keen as the mayor to reduce car use in the city.

entries.title: Netflix Should Buy AMC Networks And ‘The Walking Dead’
entries.description: AMC used to be riding high in the era of Breaking Bad, Mad Men and the early seasons of The Walking Dead. entries.description: Apple's new MacBook Pro laptops are powerful and competent. But some of the decisions are not consumer-friendly.

entries.title: Keep Or Vault? ‘Destiny 2’ Faces Tough Choices As It Heads Into ‘Lightfall’
entries.description: While Destiny 2 has made it clear that it will no longer be vaulting full expansions going forward, like they just did with the Forsaken campaign, which was disappeared when The Witch Queen dropped, the game still is going to lose something when Lightfall hits.

entries.title: Artificial Intelligence May Actually Help Humanize Financial Services
entries.description: 'Industrywide, we lacked some engagement, we lacked some warmth, we lacked some relevance, particularly through digital channel. We need to re-instate humanization into digital, and AI is a tool that’s going to help us get there.'

entries.title: Plainsight and MarineSitu Using ‘Computer Vision’ To Protect Sea Creatures
entries.description: The focus is on enabling marine energy devices to coexist harmoniously with aquatic life.

entries.title: USA And EU Advance AI Research In Critical Global Needs In New Administrative Agreement
entries.description: This article focuses on the AI leadership with the USA and the European Union in signing a new administrative agreement to do joint AI research in key global challenge areas like: climate change, healthcare, agriculture, etc.

entries.title: Microsoft’s Main Argument Against Sony’s ‘Call Of Duty’ Protests Doesn’t Work
entries.description: Sony is once again reportedly trying to convince regulators to block Microsoft’s acquisition of Activision Blizzard, and once again, citing the fact that they don’t believe Microsoft will offer them parity on Call of Duty once they own it.

entries.title: Fans Believe ‘The Last Of Us’ Has Found Its Abby Actress For Season 2
entries.description: Easily, one of the biggest questions about adapting The Last of Us Part 2 is the casting of Abby, who essentially has half or more of the narrative of that game, though I won’t spoil her exact role here. And fans believe they think they know who the show wants as Abby.
